page.title: 12MARLBOROUGH'S POLITICS
page.content: Marlborough is an average sort of rural market town in Southern England, and as would be expected, most people vote Conservative and hold views which are Right of Centre. Until recently, the Liberals have always been the thrid party behind Labour, but now all this is changing, with growing discontent among traditional Tory voters. Because of what they see as unjust treatment by the Government and the EEC, many are switching their allegiance to the Liberal Party. Labour's poor showing in the recent elections for Wiltshire County Council can be put down to tactical voting by the Conservative opposers and this has resulted in a council with no party in majority; Jack Ainslie's Liberals are the largest party represented often able to find support from all parties.
